name: British Shortcrust Pie Pastry
author: Piques
summary: Many British recipes call for shortcrust pastry. This makes a great alternative to pre-made crusts. Because it is so easy to make in batches, I make extra to freeze for later use. This pastry dough can also be kept in the fridge for 2 to 3 days.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons ice water, or more as needed
directions: Combine flour, butter, and shortening using a food processor until crumbly
Mix in water 1 tablespoon at at time until dough is soft and pliable
Wrap dough in plastic wrap; let rest in a refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before using
